ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Performed a lot of the key experiments from the lecture course, which helped deepen my understanding of the content
Lot of technical but sort of irrelevant skills. The part of this course that was really valuable was connecting the lab to concepts from lecture.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Kathy is amazing. Best STEM prof/preceptor I've had at Yale, hands down. She made the class fun, but also explained things in a very digestable manner
This course was overall good, but expectations weren't always cleared and the teaching staff weren't always prepared, so we often spent a lot of time waiting around.

The main strengths are the experiments and methods that the class exposes us to. The main weakness is in the planning of the lab on the day itself in that many times there werre malfunctioning of machines or not enough time to do the actual experiments, so it ended up being less hands-on than ideal.
Some of the lab equipment is really old. A lot of the labs were frustrating because the equipment didn't work.

The only thing I request is that in the future please ask Professor Haig to show us the demonstration AS we do the experiment ourselves, instead of doing the whole experiment, and somehow expecting us to replicate all the steps all over again.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Lab was really enjoyable and has improved a lot from what it used to be! The grading system rewards improvement, so it's honestly low stress, although it is a lot of work as any lab course is
This is a fun course. If you're interested in neuro and don't mind a long lab, I would recommend.
I would because if they are particularly interested in neurobiology because you do get a lot of great exposure and get to learn about those subjects in a new and insightful way.
